intro: Sphaerostephanos plurivenosus, commonly known as the multivenous spherical star, is a rare and unique plant characterized by its intricate floral structure. It features a central spherical flower surrounded by multiple radiating petals, each with distinct venation patterns. The plant exhibits a complex arrangement of stamens and carpels, contributing to its botanical uniqueness. It is typically found in specific microhabitats with high humidity and partial shade. Its morphology reflects adaptations to its ecological niche, making it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
